channel.title: Low end games?
channel.description:
Are there any low end games anybody knows of? All I have is an acer chromebook C720 with lubuntu + wine.
Specs: Ram: 2GB CPU: Intel Haswell dual core 1.4GHz GPU: Integrated Intel HD Haswell (64mb video memory) SSD: 16GB
The ssd only has about 3GB left on it but I have a 750GB external drive hdd I have been using. I am just having issues finding many games I can get to run. I was told torchlight would run fine but it crashes upon creating a character (steam version). Only two games I have right now are Minecraft and Unturned.
Before you say "get a better pc" bear in mind I am currently saving for this but until then I would like something to do.

item.title: Low end games?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:12, topic:547071”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=665972.msg4452335#msg4452335 date=1412414511]
Half Life doesnt seem to want to run under WINE, will have to attempt at finding a Linux download thats free.

In process of downloading:
Street Legal Racing Redline 2.30LE (this is a test to see if it was a directx error of why it wouldn’t start earlier. Will report back)
Roller Coaster Tycoon 1 & 2, Hopefully the DirectX error is fixed. Thanks to steam/torchlight
[/quote]
Use the steam version lol.[/quote]
I would gladly use the Steam version but I can’t find my card

Read full topic

item.title: Low end games?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Looked up Half Life. What I’m confused about is why the PC version requires such low specs while linux actually needs some beef to the computer lol.

Check it out:

EDIT: Just finished the Half Life 1 downloads. Will check it out and let ya know how it goes.

Read full topic

item.title: Low end games?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:547071”]I expected throwback games to be listed because honestly not many people who have such low end power even think about games.

RTC - kept getting a directX error. Torchlight managed to install needed things for directX to work for it, going to try that again. As for Half Life, I’ve never played them. What’s the story like? Only thing I know about half life is Garry’s mod lol.[/quote]
Most Source Engine games support pretty low end devices, you might be able to run HL2 even, but the HL story/universe is a really amazing one if you get into it. Definitely worth getting, I’ve beaten HL2, EP1, and EP2, however I’ve never fully beaten HL1, but I know the story.

Read full topic

RTC - kept getting a directX error. Torchlight managed to install needed things for directX to work for it, going to try that again. As for Half Life, I’ve never played them. What’s the story like? Only thing I know about half life is Garry’s mod lol.

item.title: Low end games?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

roller coaster tycoon, pharaoh, aoe II

pharaoh’s a fun one. Might I suggest some throw back games like Half-Life 1, and the Command and Conquer games? I got the whole 17 pack for C&C, those were some of my favorite games growing up and still are, they’re all RTS except for Renegade, which was Westwood’s first-person rendition of the Command and Conquer story, I’ve beaten it so many times, currently I’m trying to run through it on the hardest difficulty and keep rage quitting lol.

I doubt you could run the newer C&C’s like C&C4, Red Alert 3, and Generals, however the old ones are equally fun.

Read full topic
